articles.title: A new advance in a two-century pursuit in physics
articles.summary: A powerful new method for characterizing semiconductor materials finds its roots in ancient mathematics.

articles.title: How community shaped IBM Quantum Developer Conference 2025
articles.summary: Centering on the theme of "Quantum Advantage Together," QDC[25] was defined by a community working to build the future of quantum computing.

articles.title: Benchmark-to-benchmark comparisons made easier
articles.summary: IBM and University of Notre Dame are open-sourcing a template and automation tool for creating LLM benchmark cards at scale.

articles.title: Boost your tools: Introducing ToolOps, the tool lifecycle extension in ALTK
IBM Granite is ranked world's most transparent model
articles.summary: The Stanford University Foundation Model Transparency Index has ranked IBM Granite number one this year — with the highest score in the history of the index.

articles.title: Teams of agents can take the headaches — and potential costs — out of finding IT bugs
articles.summary: IBM Research’s Project ALICE is a new experimental multi-agent system that can help engineers speed up the time it takes to locate and quash software bugs.

articles.title: IBM’s software engineering agent tops leaderboard for Java
articles.summary: iSWE-Agent entries, one using a single run with a frontier model and one using inference scaling with open models, earned the top spots on Multi-SWE-Bench.

articles.title: Teaching LLMs how to count
articles.summary: In a spotlight poster at NeurIPS 2025, IBM researchers propose changing a popular LLM architecture to improve their logical reasoning capabilities.

articles.title: How UTokyo & IBM developed new quantum simulation algorithm
articles.summary: University of Tokyo and IBM researchers extended the capabilities of quantum computers to simulate condensed matter with smart algorithm design.

articles.title: IBM and Kaggle launch new AI leaderboards for enterprise tasks
articles.summary: The new leaderboards, built atop benchmarks initiated by IBM Research, are designed to accelerate progress building and evaluating AI models and agents that can solve real-world enterprise issues.

articles.title: IBM Granite 4.0: Hyper-efficient, high performance hybrid models for India
IBM and ESA release new dataset for mapping floods and fires
articles.summary: The multi-modal TerraMind models were fine-tuned on a first-of-its kind dataset designed to improve how we prepare and respond to natural disasters.

articles.title: Scaling beyond our roadmap with networked quantum computers
articles.summary: Initiating the research and collaboration needed to build the quantum computers of the future.

articles.title: Utility-scale dynamic circuits now available for all users
articles.summary: A recent refresh of Qiskit Runtime’s dynamic circuits implementation brings powerful new efficiencies and capabilities to the utility scale.

articles.title: Accelerating AI inference with IBM Storage Scale
articles.summary: IBM Storage Scale is ideal for providing persistent space for KV data, storing it for a virtually unlimited number of active users and agent sessions.

articles.title: Making open infrastructure for AI a reality, together
articles.summary: At this year’s AI Hardware Forum, IBM Research and its partners showcased how they’re transforming the AI age with complete solutions in an open ecosystem.

articles.title: An 'undo-and-retry' mechanism for agents
articles.summary: IBM and University of Illinois IBM Research and University of Illinois propose a Ctrl-Z feature for agents that could help to resolve IT issues faster

articles.title: The future of AI is in your hands
articles.summary: Small models and powerful personal devices are poised to upend how we use AI.

articles.title: Building quantum computers with advanced semiconductor fab
articles.summary: An inside look at how IBM® is using state-of-the-art 300mm semiconductor fabrication technology to build the future of quantum hardware.

articles.title: Scaling for quantum advantage and beyond
articles.summary: IBM® lays out the groundbreaking advances in algorithms, hardware, and software that will empower our community to achieve quantum advantage together.

articles.title: The Coherence Times: an IBM Quantum podcast
articles.summary: New weekly podcast introduces you to the thought leaders, researchers, developers, and technologists building the future of quantum computing.

articles.title: Leading the way in open Earth observation AI
articles.summary: Understanding our planet has never been more critical. From insurance and finance to logistics and agriculture, countless industries need reliable insights about how the Earth behaves. Foundational AI is opening unprecedented possibilities for how we observe and measure our world — and IBM Research, together with NASA, the European Space Agency and other partners — is at the forefront of this transformation.

articles.title: Discovering a new quantum algorithm
articles.summary: How group theory and the non-Abelian Fourier transform open the door to new quantum computing research applications.

articles.title: Boost your agents: Introducing ALTK, the open-source agent lifecycle toolkit
A tribute to the art and science of generative AI
articles.summary: IBM researcher and artist Mauro Martino explains AI's inspiration and contributions to his latest work of art.

articles.title: What's new at IBM Quantum Q3 2025
IBM is expanding open-source AI model training and inference
articles.summary: At PyTorch 2025, IBM showed off the new open-source AI software tools that are redefining possibilities for a multi-AI accelerator world.

articles.title: Qiskit C API enables new end-to-end quantum + HPC workflows
articles.summary: Build end-to-end quantum + HPC workflows as a single application written natively in popular HPC programming languages like C++ with our new demo.

articles.title: Release News: Qiskit SDK v2.2 is here!
articles.summary: Technical release summary for Qiskit SDK v2.2, including updates on the new end-to-end quantum + HPC workflow demo enabled by Qiskit's C API.

articles.title: Introducing Thinking-in-Modalities with TerraMind
Toucan takes tool-calling to a whole new scale
articles.summary: Open-sourced by IBM and UW, Toucan is designed to improve how agents accomplish real-world tasks.

articles.title: Introducing CUGA: The enterprise-ready configurable generalist agent
Introducing IBM's new toolkit for AI steering
articles.summary: AI Steerability 360 lets you build and test pipelines for customizing LLM generation.

articles.title: How the Basque Country became a leader in quantum computing
articles.summary: In a few short years, the Basque Country has established itself as a global player in quantum computing. Here’s how.

articles.title: New tiny AI models for Earth observation
articles.summary: IBM Research and partners unveil new versions of Prithvi and TerraMind that are small enough to run on a smartphone.

articles.title: Building the IBM Spyre Accelerator
articles.summary: IBM Spyre is becoming available for IBM z17, Power11, and LinuxONE 5 systems. Here’s how its journey began in the AI Hardware Center at IBM Research.

articles.title: IBM and partners open-source a new AI model for monitoring Earth’s oceans
articles.summary: Granite-Geospatial-Ocean can be used to monitor the health of marine ecosystems and the oceans' uptake of carbon.

articles.title: New AI model finds railroad defects before they’re critical
articles.summary: A new AI model detects and tracks rail maintenance issues before they can cause problems, freeing up skilled workers from tedious inspections.

articles.title: IBM and Vanguard explore quantum optimization for finance
articles.summary: Variational quantum algorithms for portfolio optimization.

articles.title: IBM's time-series foundation model reaches #2 on GIFT-Eval
articles.summary: The model uses a state space architecture to outperform time-series models at least 20 times bigger.

articles.title: How AI alignment differs from AI steering
articles.summary: IBM Fellow Kush Varshney explains the difference, and provides an update on IBM's latest work to mitigate the safety risks around generative AI.

articles.title: HSBC explores algorithmic trading with IBM quantum computers
articles.summary: Researchers deliver first-known empirical evidence that quantum computers could soon solve valuable problems in algorithmic bond trading.

articles.title: IBM and BharatGen collaborate for India's AI needs
articles.summary: Using the multimodal AI and LLMs BharatGen is working on, it will work with IBM to build the unique tools needed to best serve Indian language speakers.

articles.title: Building software for quantum-centric supercomputing
articles.summary: Explore open-source tools that IBM and its partners are creating to enable seamless integrations of quantum and classical high-performance computing resources.

articles.title: Improving AI agent reliability with BeeAI
articles.summary: The RequirementAgent from the BeeAI Framework is an innovative approach that provides the reliability needed for production scenarios made simple.

articles.title: Register for the new Qiskit v2.X developer certification
articles.summary: Updated Qiskit developer certification exam tests your ability to perform essential quantum computing tasks with the latest version of Qiskit.

articles.title: IBM researchers win prestigious European grants
articles.summary: Ghazi Sarwat Syed and Gregor Seiler add to IBM Research’s strong history with European Research Council grants.

articles.title: Ado: The accelerated discovery orchestrator
articles.summary: The new platform for computational experiments at scale.

articles.title: IBM further strengthens Granite for enterprise deployment with HackerOne
articles.summary: IBM is partnering with HackerOne to offer a bug bounty program for Granite, with up to $100,000 in bounty payouts available. The objective is to identify successful jailbreaks of Granite models deployed in enterprise-like settings with guardrails enabled, as businesses look to scale their AI workflows.

articles.title: Introducing Surya, a new heliophysics foundation model
articles.summary: IBM and NASA open-source a new AI foundation model for the Sun that could change how we look at solar flares.
